definition: to rely on help from sb
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)

sentences.english: It was fine at first; most of my friends had moved home too.
sentences.chinese: 起初我覺得還好，我的很多朋友也都回家投靠父母了。

sentences.english: The police had sold themselves to the gang leaders.
sentences.chinese: 那些警察已賣身投靠匪首。

sentences.english: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in princes.
sentences.chinese: 投靠耶和華，強似倚賴王子。

sentences.english: He is a shield for all who take refuge in him.
sentences.chinese: 凡投靠他的，他便作他們的盾牌。

sentences.english: He committed suicide rather than sell himself to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他寧願自殺而不願賣身投靠敵人。

sentences.english: Sibling two people have resorted to take refuge in tears fiance peng shrimp monsters.
sentences.chinese: 兄妹二人只得去投靠秋菊的未婚夫彭蝦仔。

sentences.english: Troops were deserting to the enemy.
The Union leaders were accused of selling out to the employers.
sentences.chinese: 工會領導人被指責賣身投靠僱主。

sentences.english: Announced to the public anti-japanese hero Zhao Chuanji take refuge in the Japanese drama.
sentences.chinese: 來向公衆們宣佈抗日英雄趙傳奇投靠日軍的戲碼。

sentences.english: We think that they're taking the children to their real parents in the US.
sentences.chinese: 我們猜他們想把孩子帶到美國投靠親生父母。

sentences.english: Officials are first trying to reunite orphaned children with other relatives.
sentences.chinese: 官方的最初嘗試是讓這些孤兒投靠親屬。

sentences.english: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
sentences.chinese: 投靠耶和華，強似倚賴王子。

sentences.english: Or to join as husband and wife, Nong Zhuanfei this, they both fall under the control of the public security organs.
sentences.chinese: 否則像夫妻投靠，農轉非這種，都是歸公安機關管的。

sentences.english: I got it after defecting to the Soviet Union.
sentences.chinese: 我投靠蘇聯之後受的傷。

sentences.english: In 1936 Chiang Kai-shek bribed the Kwangtung air force to defect to the central government.
sentences.chinese: 1936年蔣介石賄賂廣東空軍投靠中央政府。

definition: to surrender and pay allegiance to
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to vow loyalty and devotion to
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
